Subjective: Back pain for 1.5 weeks. Radiates down right leg via back and side to foot. Pain all day long. No relief from paracetamol/ibuprofen. Trouble sleeping. Unable to work due to pain. Negatives: No trauma, no numbness/tingling. Social: Works in supermarket. Lives alone. ICE: Wants pain relief.
Objective: BP: Not measured. Extremities: No edema. Lungs: Clear on auscultation. Neuro: Strength normal in left leg, reduced in right leg. Reflexes normal. Musculoskeletal: Pain on palpation of right lower back and leg.
Assessment: Herniated intervertebral disc, likely causing nerve compression and pain. Ruled out: Other causes of back pain.
Plan: 1. Pregabalin for pain relief. 2. Physiotherapy for exercises and back flexibility. 3. Follow-up telephone appointment in 1 week. 4. Contact doctor or GP out-of-hours service if symptoms worsen. 5. No surgery or scan necessary at this time.
